page.title: 19CORBY T.V. VIEWING SURVEY.
page.content: This was Men's Singles Final Day at Wimbledon, so it was to be expected that world-wide audience would include a large proportion of our school population. The following day we surveyed over half the school and found that 87% had viewed on Sunday, 45% for more than three hours! A symptom of the age! Pundits, parents and teachers frequently bemoan the excessive amount of time "glued to the box". It can be argued that the increasing selfishness and passivity of the young is caused by habitual viewing; and certainly the high juvenile crime rate can be linked to T.V. Anti-social behaviour might stem from bad examples and unsatisfied craving stimulated by advertising and fictional lifestyles beyond our reach.
